cards.name: The Fool
cards.upright_meaning: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, a free spirit, taking a leap of faith
cards.reversed_meaning: Recklessness, taking risks, lack of direction, naivety, poor judgment
cards.description: The Fool represents new beginnings and adventures. It symbolizes infinite possibilities and taking a leap of faith into the unknown.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.upright_meaning: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action, making dreams reality
cards.reversed_meaning: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents, illusion, deception
cards.description: The Magician represents manifestation and the power to turn dreams into reality through willpower and skill.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.upright_meaning: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, the subconscious mind, secrets
cards.reversed_meaning: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal and silence, repressed feelings
cards.description: The High Priestess represents intuition, spiritual insight, and the mysteries of the subconscious.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.upright_meaning: Femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing, abundance, creativity, fertility
cards.reversed_meaning: Creative block, dependence on others, emptiness, lack of growth
cards.description: The Empress represents fertility, abundance, and the nurturing aspects of life and creativity.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.upright_meaning: Authority, establishment, structure, a father figure, control and discipline
cards.reversed_meaning: Domination, excessive control, lack of discipline, inflexibility, tyranny
cards.description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and the establishment of order and control.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.upright_meaning: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, institutions
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo, unconventional
cards.description: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, tradition, and conventional beliefs and institutions.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.upright_meaning: Love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, choices, partnership
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-love, disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values, conflict
cards.description: The Lovers represents love, harmony, and important choices about relationships and values.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.upright_meaning: Control, willpower, success, action, determination, moving forward
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-discipline, opposition, lack of direction, lack of control
cards.description: The Chariot represents determination, willpower, and triumph through focused action.

cards.name: Strength
cards.upright_meaning: Strength, courage, persuasion, influence, compassion, inner strength
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner strength, self-doubt, low energy, raw emotion, lack of confidence
cards.description: Strength represents inner strength, courage, and the power of compassion over brute force.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.upright_meaning: Soul searching, introspection, being alone, inner guidance, contemplation
cards.reversed_meaning: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, recluse, exile from others
cards.description: The Hermit represents introspection, soul searching, and finding wisdom through solitude.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.upright_meaning: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, a turning point, change
cards.reversed_meaning: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles, lack of control
cards.description: The Wheel of Fortune represents cycles, fate, and the ever-changing nature of life.

cards.name: Justice
cards.upright_meaning: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law, accountability
cards.reversed_meaning: Unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty, legal complications
cards.description: Justice represents fairness, truth, and the law of cause and effect.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.upright_meaning: Pause, surrender, letting go, new perspectives, sacrifice for greater good
cards.reversed_meaning: Delays, resistance, stalling, indecision, stagnation
cards.description: The Hanged Man represents surrender, new perspectives, and the wisdom gained through sacrifice.

cards.name: Death
cards.upright_meaning: Endings, change, transformation, transition, letting go of the old
cards.reversed_meaning: Resistance to change, personal transformation, inner purging, fear of change
cards.description: Death represents transformation, endings that lead to new beginnings, and the cycle of life.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.upright_meaning: Balance, moderation, patience, purpose, finding meaning in life
cards.reversed_meaning: Imbalance, excess, self-healing, re-alignment, lack of harmony
cards.description: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and finding the middle path.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.upright_meaning: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, materialism, bondage
cards.reversed_meaning: Releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment, freedom
cards.description: The Devil represents bondage, materialism, and the shadow aspects of ourselves.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.upright_meaning: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening, disruption
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal transformation, fear of change, averting disaster, delayed disaster
cards.description: The Tower represents sudden upheaval, revelation, and necessary destruction of false beliefs.

cards.name: The Star
cards.upright_meaning: Hope, faith, purpose, renewal, spirituality, inspiration, serenity
cards.reversed_meaning: Lack of faith, despair, self-trust, disconnection, discouragement
cards.description: The Star represents hope, faith, and spiritual renewal after difficult times.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.upright_meaning: Illusion, fear, anxiety, subconscious, intuition, hidden truths
cards.reversed_meaning: Release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion, self-deception
cards.description: The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and navigating uncertainty and hidden fears.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.upright_meaning: Positivity, fun, warmth, success, vitality, joy, enlightenment
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic, temporary depression
cards.description: The Sun represents joy, success, vitality, and the warmth of life's blessings.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.upright_meaning: Judgement, rebirth, inner calling, absolution, self-evaluation
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call, self-loathing
cards.description: Judgement represents self-evaluation, rebirth, and answering a higher calling.

cards.name: The World
cards.upright_meaning: Completion, accomplishment, travel, fulfillment, sense of belonging
cards.reversed_meaning: Seeking personal closure, short-cuts, delays, incomplete goals
cards.description: The World represents completion, accomplishment, and the fulfillment of a cycle.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Inspiration, new opportunities, growth, potential, creative spark
cards.reversed_meaning: Emerging ideas, lack of direction, distractions, delays in progress
cards.description: The Ace of Wands represents new creative beginnings and the spark of inspiration.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Future planning, progress, decisions, discovery, personal power
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal goals, inner alignment, fear of unknown, lack of planning
cards.description: The Two of Wands represents planning for the future and making bold decisions.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Progress, expansion, foresight, overseas opportunities, looking ahead
cards.reversed_meaning: Playing small, lack of foresight, unexpected delays, obstacles
cards.description: The Three of Wands represents expansion, foresight, and looking toward the horizon.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Celebration, joy, harmony, relaxation, homecoming, community
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal celebration, inner harmony, conflict with others, tension
cards.description: The Four of Wands represents celebration, harmony, and joyful gatherings.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Conflict, disagreements, competition, tension, diversity of opinion
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner conflict, conflict avoidance, tension release, cooperation
cards.description: The Five of Wands represents conflict, competition, and diverse viewpoints clashing.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Success, public recognition, progress, self-confidence, achievement
cards.reversed_meaning: Private achievement, self-definition, fall from grace, lack of recognition
cards.description: The Six of Wands represents success, recognition, and victorious achievement.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Challenge, competition, protection, perseverance, defending your position
cards.reversed_meaning: Exhaustion, giving up, overwhelmed, surrender, weakness
cards.description: The Seven of Wands represents defending your position and standing your ground.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Movement, fast paced change, action, alignment, sudden progress
cards.reversed_meaning: Delays, frustration, resisting change, internal alignment needed
cards.description: The Eight of Wands represents swift action, rapid movement, and quick progress.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Resilience, courage, persistence, test of faith, last stand
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner resources, struggle, overwhelm, defensive, paranoia
cards.description: The Nine of Wands represents resilience, persistence, and standing strong despite challenges.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Burden, extra responsibility, hard work, completion, stress
cards.reversed_meaning: Doing it all, delegation, release of burden, lighter load
cards.description: The Ten of Wands represents burden, responsibility, and the weight of success.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Inspiration, ideas, discovery, limitless potential, free spirit
cards.reversed_meaning: Newly-formed ideas, redirecting energy, self-limiting beliefs, procrastination
cards.description: The Page of Wands represents enthusiasm, exploration, and the spark of new ideas.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Energy, passion, inspired action, adventure, impulsiveness
cards.reversed_meaning: Passion project, haste, scattered energy, delays, frustration
cards.description: The Knight of Wands represents passionate action, adventure, and bold energy.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Courage, confidence, independence, social butterfly, determination
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-respect, self-confidence, introvert, re-establish sense of self
cards.description: The Queen of Wands represents confidence, courage, and charismatic leadership.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.upright_meaning: Natural-born leader, vision, entrepreneur, honour, confidence
cards.reversed_meaning: Impulsiveness, haste, ruthless, high expectations, dictatorship
cards.description: The King of Wands represents visionary leadership, entrepreneurship, and bold action.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Love, new relationships, compassion, creativity, overflowing emotions
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-love, intuition, repressed emotions, emotional emptiness
cards.description: The Ace of Cups represents new emotional beginnings, love, and spiritual abundance.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Unified love, partnership, mutual attraction, relationships, connection
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-love, break-ups, disharmony, distrust, imbalance
cards.description: The Two of Cups represents partnership, mutual attraction, and harmonious relationships.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Celebration, friendship, creativity, collaborations, joyful gatherings
cards.reversed_meaning: Independence, alone time, hardcore partying, feeling left out
cards.description: The Three of Cups represents celebration, friendship, and creative collaboration.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Meditation, contemplation, apathy, reevaluation, discontent
cards.reversed_meaning: Retreat, withdrawal, checking in for alignment, new perspectives
cards.description: The Four of Cups represents contemplation, apathy, and reevaluating what matters.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Regret, failure, disappointment, pessimism, dwelling on the past
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal setbacks, self-forgiveness, moving on, acceptance
cards.description: The Five of Cups represents loss, regret, and learning to move forward.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Revisiting the past, childhood memories, innocence, joy, nostalgia
cards.reversed_meaning: Living in the past, forgiveness, lacking playfulness, moving forward
cards.description: The Six of Cups represents nostalgia, childhood memories, and innocent joy.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Opportunities, choices, wishful thinking, illusion, daydreaming
cards.reversed_meaning: Alignment, personal values, overwhelmed by choices, clarity
cards.description: The Seven of Cups represents choices, illusions, and discerning reality from fantasy.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Disappointment, abandonment, withdrawal, escapism, searching for truth
cards.reversed_meaning: Trying one more time, indecision, aimless drifting, fear of change
cards.description: The Eight of Cups represents walking away from disappointment to seek deeper meaning.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Contentment, satisfaction, gratitude, wish come true, happiness
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner happiness, materialism, dissatisfaction, indulgence
cards.description: The Nine of Cups represents contentment, satisfaction, and wishes fulfilled.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Divine love, blissful relationships, harmony, alignment, happy family
cards.reversed_meaning: Disconnection, misaligned values, struggling relationships, unhappy home
cards.description: The Ten of Cups represents emotional fulfillment, harmony, and blessed relationships.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Creative opportunities, intuitive messages, curiosity, new ideas
cards.reversed_meaning: New ideas, doubting intuition, creative blocks, emotional immaturity
cards.description: The Page of Cups represents creative inspiration, intuitive messages, and emotional curiosity.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Creativity, romance, charm, imagination, beauty, following your heart
cards.reversed_meaning: Overactive imagination, unrealistic, jealous, moody, disappointment
cards.description: The Knight of Cups represents romantic gestures, creativity, and following your heart.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Compassionate, caring, emotionally stable, intuitive, in flow
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner feelings, self-care, self-love, co-dependency, martyrdom
cards.description: The Queen of Cups represents compassion, emotional maturity, and intuitive wisdom.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.upright_meaning: Emotionally balanced, compassionate, diplomatic, caring, wise counsel
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-compassion, inner feelings, moodiness, emotional manipulation
cards.description: The King of Cups represents emotional maturity, wisdom, and diplomatic compassion.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Breakthroughs, new ideas, mental clarity, success, raw power
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner clarity, re-thinking an idea, clouded judgment, confusion
cards.description: The Ace of Swords represents mental clarity, breakthroughs, and the power of truth.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Difficult decisions, weighing options, an impasse, avoidance, stalemate
cards.reversed_meaning: Indecision, confusion, information overload, too many choices
cards.description: The Two of Swords represents difficult decisions and weighing conflicting options.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Heartbreak, emotional pain, sorrow, grief, hurt, separation
cards.reversed_meaning: Recovery, forgiveness, moving on, releasing pain, optimism
cards.description: The Three of Swords represents heartbreak, emotional pain, and necessary sorrow.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Rest, relaxation, meditation, contemplation, recuperation, peace
cards.reversed_meaning: Exhaustion, burn-out, deep contemplation, stagnation, rest needed
cards.description: The Four of Swords represents rest, recuperation, and peaceful contemplation.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Conflict, disagreements, competition, defeat, winning at all costs
cards.reversed_meaning: Reconciliation, making amends, past resentment, desire to end conflict
cards.description: The Five of Swords represents conflict, competition, and the cost of victory.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Transition, change, rite of passage, releasing baggage, moving forward
cards.reversed_meaning: Personal transition, resistance to change, unfinished business
cards.description: The Six of Swords represents transition, moving forward, and leaving difficulties behind.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Betrayal, deception, getting away with something, acting strategically
cards.reversed_meaning: Imposter syndrome, self-deceit, keeping secrets, coming clean
cards.description: The Seven of Swords represents deception, strategy, and acting with stealth.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Negative thoughts, self-imposed restriction, imprisonment, confusion
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-limiting beliefs, inner critic, releasing negative thoughts, freedom
cards.description: The Eight of Swords represents self-imposed limitations and feeling trapped by thoughts.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Anxiety, worry, fear, depression, nightmares, mental anguish
cards.reversed_meaning: Inner turmoil, deep-seated fears, secrets, releasing worry
cards.description: The Nine of Swords represents anxiety, worry, and mental distress.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Painful endings, deep wounds, betrayal, loss, crisis, hitting rock bottom
cards.reversed_meaning: Recovery, regeneration, resisting an inevitable end, old wounds
cards.description: The Ten of Swords represents painful endings, rock bottom, and the final crisis.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: New ideas, curiosity, thirst for knowledge, new ways of communicating
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-expression, all talk and no action, haphazard action, gossip
cards.description: The Page of Swords represents curiosity, new ideas, and mental agility.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Ambitious, action-oriented, driven to succeed, fast-thinking, assertive
cards.reversed_meaning: Restless, unfocused, impulsive, burn-out, reckless behavior
cards.description: The Knight of Swords represents swift action, ambition, and driven pursuit of goals.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Independent, unbiased judgement, clear boundaries, direct communication
cards.reversed_meaning: Overly-emotional, easily influenced, bitchy, cold-hearted, withdrawn
cards.description: The Queen of Swords represents clarity, independence, and direct communication.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.upright_meaning: Mental clarity, intellectual power, authority, truth, structure
cards.reversed_meaning: Quiet power, inner truth, misuse of power, manipulation, tyranny
cards.description: The King of Swords represents intellectual authority, mental clarity, and truth.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: New financial opportunity, prosperity, abundance, manifestation, security
cards.reversed_meaning: Lost opportunity, missed chance, lack of planning, poor financial decisions
cards.description: The Ace of Pentacles represents new financial opportunities and material abundance.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Multiple priorities, time management, prioritisation, adaptability
cards.reversed_meaning: Over-committed, disorganisation, reprioritisation, overwhelm
cards.description: The Two of Pentacles represents juggling priorities and maintaining balance.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Teamwork, collaboration, learning, implementation, building success
cards.reversed_meaning: Disharmony, misalignment, working alone, lack of team work
cards.description: The Three of Pentacles represents teamwork, collaboration, and skilled craftsmanship.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Saving money, security, conservatism, scarcity, control
cards.reversed_meaning: Over-spending, greed, self-protection, financial insecurity
cards.description: The Four of Pentacles represents security, control, and holding onto resources.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Financial loss, poverty, lack mindset, isolation, insecurity
cards.reversed_meaning: Recovery from financial loss, spiritual poverty, positive changes
cards.description: The Five of Pentacles represents financial hardship, loss, and feeling left out in the cold.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Giving, receiving, sharing wealth, generosity, charity, balance
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-care, unpaid debts, one-sided charity, strings attached
cards.description: The Six of Pentacles represents generosity, charity, and the balance of giving and receiving.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Long-term view, sustainable results, perseverance, investment, patience
cards.reversed_meaning: Lack of long-term vision, limited success, lack of rewards, impatience
cards.description: The Seven of Pentacles represents patience, perseverance, and long-term investments paying off.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Apprenticeship, repetitive tasks, mastery, skill development, dedication
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-development, perfectionism, misdirected activity, lack of motivation
cards.description: The Eight of Pentacles represents dedication, mastery, and skillful work.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Abundance, luxury, self-sufficiency, financial independence, success
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-worth, over-investment in work, hustling, financial setbacks
cards.description: The Nine of Pentacles represents abundance, luxury, and self-sufficient success.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Wealth, financial security, family, long-term success, legacy
cards.reversed_meaning: Financial failure, loneliness, loss, family conflict, legacy issues
cards.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents wealth, legacy, and long-term financial security.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Manifestation, financial opportunity, new job, ambition, focus
cards.reversed_meaning: Lack of progress, procrastination, learn from failure, short-sightedness
cards.description: The Page of Pentacles represents new opportunities, ambition, and practical learning.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Hard work, productivity, routine, conservatism, methodical approach
cards.reversed_meaning: Self-discipline, boredom, feeling stuck, perfectionism, laziness
cards.description: The Knight of Pentacles represents hard work, dedication, and steady progress.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Nurturing, practical, providing financially, a working parent, resourceful
cards.reversed_meaning: Financial independence, self-care, work-home conflict, smothering
cards.description: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing abundance, practical wisdom, and material comfort.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.upright_meaning: Wealth, business, leadership, security, discipline, abundance, success
cards.reversed_meaning: Financially inept, obsessed with wealth, stubborn, greed, materialistic
cards.description: The King of Pentacles represents wealth, business acumen, and material mastery.
